snippet: Profits also soared in the latest quarter at the newly independent Fox entertainment arm.
abstract: Entertainment arm of 21st Century Fox reports 16 percent uptick in revenue for quarter ending in June, thanks in part to higher cable subscriber fees for its cable channels; net income for 21st Century Fox side of business was $977 million in quarter, or 42 cents a share, up from $596 million, or 25 cents a share, in same quarter year earlier.
lead_paragraph: Profits also soared in the latest quarter at the newly independent Fox entertainment arm.

headline.main: 21st Century Fox Has 16% Jump in Revenue on Higher Cable Fees
headline.print_headline: Cable Fees Push Profit At Murdoch Media Arm
